results.title: A Fishy problem
results.creator_credit: Astrid Silberman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Astrid Silberman attempts to recreate her family recipe for Gefilte fish. She has trouble deciding whether to follow the traditional recipe or to come up with a new interpretation on the old tradition. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Astrid Silberman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Fate makes all the moves
results.creator_credit: Idit Benjamin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Video and Animation Workshops 2006
results.brief_description: A selection of video and animated works created by young students from different schools in various ACMI Workshops during 2006, including “Scratch it”, “Digital Poetry”, and “Claymation”. Also includes two untitled abstract animated works.
results.description: A selection of video and animated works created by young students from different schools in various ACMI Workshops during 2006, including “Scratch it”, “Digital Poetry”, and “Claymation”. Also includes two untitled abstract animated works.

results.title: Super Penguin
results.brief_description: A short film made in a one-day ACMI Claymation workshop where students are taught the basics of stop motion animation using modelling clay, a digital video camera and editing software. They also create an original soundtrack for their film

results.title: Of me: digital poetry. No. 2
results.brief_description: Digital Poetry discusses the aesthetics, form, content and meaning of poetry by combining the elements of music and the moving image in a personal workshop designed for young people.
